response: "{ \"title\": \"Harshad Number Checker\", \"description\": \"A Harshad number, also known as a Niven number, is an integer that is divisible by the sum of its digits. For example, 18 is a Harshad number because it is divisible by the sum of its digits (1 + 8 = 9 and 18 is divisible by 9). Write a function `is_harshad` that takes an integer as input and returns `True` if the number is a Harshad number, `False` otherwise.\\n\\n#### Function Signature\\n```python\\ndef is_harshad(n: int) -> bool:\\n```\\n\\n#### Input\\n- `n` (int): A positive integer.\\n\\n#### Output\\n- Returns `True` if the input integer is a Harshad number, `False` otherwise.\", \"code\": \"\\nimport math\\n\\ndef is_harshad(n: int) -> bool:\\n    # Calculate the sum of the digits\\n    sum_of_digits = sum(int(digit) for digit in str(n))\\n    \\n    # Check if the number is divisible by the sum of its digits\\n    return n % sum_of_digits == 0\\n\\n\", \"tests\": [\"assert is_harshad(18) == True\", \"assert is_harshad(12) == False\", \"assert is_harshad(36) == True\", \"assert is_harshad(4) == True\"] }"
